metadata.synopsis: When director David Merrill (Robert De Niro) returns to the United States from Paris, he is called before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Though he is not a communist, he refuses to cooperate in order to protect his friend, screenwriter Bunny Baxter (George Wendt). Merrill faces severe repercussions, however, and is blacklisted. Already on rocky terms with his wife, Ruth (Annette Bening) and unable to work in film, theater or advertising, Merrill starts to waver in his principles.

reviews: Irwin Winkler brilliantly captures the madness that overtook Hollywood in the early 1950's

Mesmo se tornando ocasionalmente maniquesta em seu nobre propsito de denunciar os absurdos do McCarthismo, o filme cumpre seu objetivo de maneira eficaz e traz, como protagonista, um heri involuntrio e falho - mas ainda assim heri.
Surprisingly thoughtful account of the Red Scare. De Niro does some great work here.
It teaches a lesson we are always in danger of forgetting: that the greatest service we can do our country is to be true to our conscience.
